raw_output:
system
You are a helpful AI for medical imaging.
user
System:
You are an expert educator in medical imaging. From the following slide text,
extract the key technical or scientific concepts that are essential for understanding the topic.

User:
SLIDE_TEXT:
So, how many nodes are in this circuit? Let’s apply the definition.

A node is any point where two or more branches connect. Here, all the points along this conducting path are electrically the same — the wires are ideal conductors with zero resistance — so we treat them as one single node. This first node connects resistor R 1, resistor R 2, resistor R 3, and the voltage source.

The other connection point, down here, is the second node. It ties together the lower ends of R 2 and R 3, the negative terminal of the voltage source, and the current source.
So even though there are multiple connection spots physically drawn, electrically, we have just two distinct nodes in this circuit.

STRICT INSTRUCTIONS:
- Return pure JSON only. No prose, no markdown, no code fences.
- Each concept must appear verbatim (case-insensitive) in SLIDE_TEXT.
- Assign exactly one category from:
  software | workflow | mathematics | signal_processing | frequency_domain |
  physics | instrumentation | data_processing | reconstruction |
  quality_metric | communication | modality | anatomy | algorithm | ai_ml
- Reject filler or administrative text.
- Output format:
{
  "concepts": [
    {"term": "<exact term from slide>", "category": "<category>"}
  ],
  "evidence": ["<short supporting phrase from SLIDE_TEXT>"]
}

assistant
{
  "concepts": [
    {"term": "nodes", "category": "physics"},
    {"term": "resistor", "category": "physics"},
    {"term": "voltage source", "category": "physics"},
    {"term": "current source", "category": "physics"},
    {"term": "ideal conductor", "category": "physics"},
    {"term": "zero resistance", "category": "physics"},
    {"term": "electrically the same", "category": "physics"},
    {"term": "connection spots", "category": "physics"},
    {"term": "distinct nodes", "category": "physics"}
  ],
  "evidence": [
    "all the points along this conducting path are electrically the same — the wires are ideal conductors with zero resistance — so we treat them as one single node.",
    "electrically, we have just two distinct nodes in this circuit."
  ]
}

evidence: all the points along this conducting path are electrically the same - the wires are ideal conductors with zero resistance - so we treat them as one single node.
electrically, we have just two distinct nodes in this circuit.
